c74object.name: bach.tree
c74object.digest: Display and edit lllls in a tree diagram
c74object.description: Provides a simple interface for displaying and editing llll as tree diagrams.

outlet.digest: The address of the clicked element
outlet.description:
An address is an llll providing a unique representation of the position of an element in another llll. It is a concept shared by many bach object. The address of each element of an llll's root level is simply its position counting from 1. The address of an element in a sublist is a list composed by the position of the element in the sublist, preceded by the position of the sublist in the parent llll, and so on up to the root level, as a sort of "path" to the element.
For instance, given the llll a b c (d e (f g) h i) j k the position of c is 3; the position of (d e (f g) h i) is 4; the position if e is 4 2 since to reach it it takes to go to the 4th element of the root level, which is a sublist, and to the 2nd element of that sublist. By reading the address from right to left, it can be seen that this is equivalent to saying that the pointed element is the 2nd of the 4th. Likewise, in the above llll f has the address 4 3 1 since it is the 1st of the 3rd of the 4th.
This outlet sends a bang whenever the tree llll has been changed via the interface.

method.name: (keyboard)
method.description:
• Cmd+T (mac) or Ctrl+T (win): Rotate selected llll node of 1 step right
• Cmd+R (mac) or Ctrl+R (win): Rotate selected llll node of 1 step left
• Cmd+I (mac) or Ctrl+I (win): Reverse llll node
• Cmd+Y (mac) or Ctrl+Y (win): Scramble llll node
• Cmd+P (mac) or Ctrl+P (win): Wrap llll node
• Cmd+Shift+P (mac) or Ctrl+Shift+P (win): Remove 1 level of parentheses
• Cmd+D (mac) or Ctrl+D (win): Duplicate node
• Cmd+C (mac) or Ctrl+C (win): Copy node content
• Cmd+V (mac) or Ctrl+V (win): Paste node content
• Cmd+Shift+D (mac) or Ctrl+Shift+D (win): Dump content
• Cmd+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Z (win): Undo
• Cmd+Shift+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Y (win): Redo
• Enter or Return: End editing tree node
• Tab and Shift+Tab: Switch to editing (respectively) next and previous tree node
• Esc: Un-click the clicked node (if any)
• ↑: Select previous item (in Outline mode)
↪ Add the Shift key to automatically open closed nodes.
• ↓: Select next item (in Outlien mode)
↪ Add the Shift key to automatically open closed nodes.
• →: Open tree node (in Outline mode)
• ←: Close tree node (in Outlien mode)

method.name: (mouse)
method.description:
The clicked element of the diagram (if any) is output from the second outlet, while its address is output from the third outlet.
Clicking on an arrow or on a non-leaf node with onlyclickonleaves set to 1 will open/close the corresponding node, and will send a notification through the third outlet, in the form open wrapped_node_address or open close_node_address. In Checkbox outline mode, a click on the checkbox will toggle the value change.
Doubleclick on an element to edit it directly, then press Enter or Return to end editing.

method.name: bang
method.description: The displayed llll is output from the first outlet, as for the dump message.

method.name: clear
method.description: The displayed llll (if any) is removed from the diagram.

method.name: click
method.digest: Set a given node as the clicked node, output information
method.description:
Syntax: click <llll/symbol: wrapped_address>
Examples:
• click (1 3 4) → click on the point having address (1 3 4)
• click () → click on root node
• click next → click on the next element
• click prev → click on the previous element
A click message sets a given node as the clicked node, and outputs its address and content through the second and third outlets. The argument is the wrapped address of the node to be clicked. Such address can be replaced by the "prev" or "next" symbols in order to click on the previous or next node, with respect to the one being currently clicked (if any). The ordering of nodes is assumed to be the one used by bach.iter while iterating. For instance, click (1 3 4) clicks on the llll element having address 1 3 4, and click next then clicks on the following address. If the clicked node was inside folded levels, such levels are properly unfolded.
See also:open,close,switch

method.name: close
method.digest: Fold diagram levels (in Outline or Checkbox Outline mode)
method.description:
Syntax: close [<list: arguments>]
Examples:
• close 0 → close root level (if visible)
• close 1 → close nodes at first level
• close 2 4 → close nodes between 2nd and 4th depth level
• close 3 -1 → close nodes at the 3rd level or deeper
• close (1 4 2) → close node at address (1 4 2)
In the Outline or Checkbox Outline mode, folds the lllls for a certain range of depths.
If no arguments are given, this folds all the llll levels.
If one integer argument is given, it is considered to be both the mindepth and the maxdepth for llll levels to be folded.
If two integer arguments are given, they are considered to be the mindepth and maxdepth for llll levels to be folded.
Depth 0 refers to the root level.
mindepth sets the minimum depth level at which the operation must be performed. If negative, the depth level is counted from the innermost level of each branch of the tree. A value of 0 is not accepted. Defaults to 1, i.e. there is no limitation.
maxdepth sets the maximum depth level at which the operation must be performed. If negative, the depth level is counted from the innermost level of each branch of the tree. A value of 0 is not accepted. Defaults to -1, i.e. there is no limitation (stop at the innermost level).
See also:open,switch,click

method.name: dump
method.description: The displayed llll is output from the first outlet.

method.name: getcheck
method.digest: Get check values (in Checkbox Outline mode)
method.description: In the Checkbox Outline mode, obtains the llll containing the check values for each element in the llll (0 = unchecked, 1 = checked). If the firsteleminllllisllllname attribute is set, first elements are associated with a value pertaining to the whole llll, which can also be -1 (if internal nodes have mixed checking. The result llll is output through the fourth outlet, preceded by the "check" symbol.

method.name: getcheck
method.digest: Get checked items (in Checkbox Outline mode)
method.description: In the Checkbox Outline mode, obtains the llll containing the checked elements for each element in the llll (0 = unchecked, 1 = checked). The result llll is output through the fourth outlet, preceded by the "checkitems" symbol.

method.name: getdomainpixels
method.digest: Obtain the visibile portion of tree in pixels
method.description: In Outline or Checkbox Outline mode, returns the vertical pixels of the visible portion of tree, with the syntax: domainpixels upper_y lower_y, where upper_y is the upper first visible pixel of the tree, and lower_y is the lower last visible pixel of the tree. If no vertical scrollbar is present, it simply returns the Y pixels of the upper and lower side of the object box. It only works in Outline or Checkbox Outline mode (nothing will happen in Node/Link mode).

method.name: llll
method.description: An incoming llll is displayed in tree form.

method.name: open
method.digest: Unfold diagram levels (in Outline or Checkbox Outline mode)
method.description:
Syntax: open [<list: arguments>]
Examples:
• open 0 → open root level (if visible)
• open 1 → open nodes at first level
• open 2 4 → open nodes between 2nd and 4th depth level
• open 3 -1 → open nodes at the 3rd level or deeper
• open (1 4 2) → open node at address (1 4 2)
In the Outline or Checkbox Outline mode, unfolds the lllls for a certain range of depths.
If no arguments are given, this unfolds all the llll levels.
If one integer argument is given, it is considered to be both the mindepth and the maxdepth for llll levels to be unfolded.
If two integer arguments are given, they are considered to be the mindepth and maxdepth for llll levels to be unfolded.
Depth 0 refers to the root level.
mindepth sets the minimum depth level at which the operation must be performed. If negative, the depth level is counted from the innermost level of each branch of the tree. A value of 0 is not accepted. Defaults to 1, i.e. there is no limitation.
maxdepth sets the maximum depth level at which the operation must be performed. If negative, the depth level is counted from the innermost level of each branch of the tree. A value of 0 is not accepted. Defaults to -1, i.e. there is no limitation (stop at the innermost level).
See also:close,switch,click

method.name: redo
method.description:
A redo message will perform a redo step.
See also:undo

method.name: setcheck
method.digest: Set check values (in Checkbox Outline mode)
method.description:
Syntax: setcheck <sym/llll: check_values>
Examples:
• setcheck all → check all elements
• setcheck none → uncheck all elements
• setcheck 1 0 0 1 → check first and last element of a plain list
• setcheck -1 (-1 (1 1 1 1) (-1 0 1)) → set (mixed) checking for more complex llll
In the Checkbox Outline mode, sets the checkbox values for each element from a given llll (0 = unchecked, 1 = checked). The setcheck all message sets all the check values to 1, the setcheck none message sets all the check values to 0.

method.name: switch
method.digest: Fold/Unfold diagram levels (in Outline or Checkbox Outline mode)
method.description:
Syntax: switch [<list: arguments>]
Examples:
• switch 0 → switch root level (if visible)
• switch 1 → switch nodes at first level
• switch 2 4 → switch nodes between 2nd and 4th depth level
• switch 3 -1 → switch nodes at the 3rd level or deeper
• switch (1 4 2) → switch node at address (1 4 2)
In the Outline or Checkbox Outline mode, folds the unfolded llll levels, and unfolds the folded llll levels, for a certain range of depths
If no arguments are given, this switches all the llll levels.
If one integer argument is given, it is considered to be both the mindepth and the maxdepth for llll levels to be switched.
If two integer arguments are given, they are considered to be the mindepth and maxdepth for llll levels to be switched.
Depth 0 refers to the root level.
mindepth sets the minimum depth level at which the operation must be performed. If negative, the depth level is counted from the innermost level of each branch of the tree. A value of 0 is not accepted. Defaults to 1, i.e. there is no limitation.
maxdepth sets the maximum depth level at which the operation must be performed. If negative, the depth level is counted from the innermost level of each branch of the tree. A value of 0 is not accepted. Defaults to -1, i.e. there is no limitation (stop at the innermost level).
See also:open,close,click

method.name: undo
method.description:
An undo message will perform an undo step.
See also:redo

attribute.name: alternate
attribute.description: Alternate stripes in the background of the object (only in Outline mode, see mode attribute, and see alternatecolor attribute).

attribute.name: alternatecolor
attribute.description: The color superposed to the bgcolor for the even-indexed stripes, if the alternate attribute is active.

attribute.name: bgcolor
attribute.description: The color of the background.

attribute.name: bordercolor
attribute.description: The color of the border.

attribute.name: checkcolor
attribute.description: The color of the checkbox (for the Checkbox Outline mode)

attribute.name: clickedstripcolor
attribute.description: The color of the strip behind the text of the selected element, in the Outline mode (see mode attribute)

attribute.name: clickedtextcolor
attribute.description: The color of the text of a selected element (element which has been just clicked upon).

attribute.name: embed
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to save the content with the patch when this latter is saved. The default behaviour is 1 (save the data with the patch).

attribute.name: enclosure
attribute.description: Toggles the display of enclosing rectangles for each tree node.

attribute.name: enclosurebgcolor
attribute.description: The background color of the rectangle enclosing each node (if the enclosure attribute is set to 1).

attribute.name: enclosurelinecolor
attribute.description: The border color of the rectangle enclosing each node (if the enclosure attribute is set to 1).

attribute.name: firsteleminllllisllllname
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to interpret first elements in each llll as the name assigned to such llll, and display that name in the llll node.

attribute.name: hinset
attribute.description: Horizontal inset of the tree display, in pixels.

attribute.name: hoverstripcolor
attribute.digest: Strip Color When Mouse Is Over
attribute.description: The color of the strip behind the text, in the Outline or Checkbox Outline mode (see mode attribute) when the mouse is over it.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Strip Color When Mouse Is Over

attribute.name: hovertextcolor
attribute.digest: Text Color When Mouse Is Over
attribute.description: The color of the text when the mouse is over it.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Text Color When Mouse Is Over

attribute.name: linecolor
attribute.description: The color of the lines linking the tree nodes.

attribute.name: linewidth
attribute.description: The width of the line linking the tree nodes

attribute.name: llllsymbol
attribute.description: A symbol serving as placeholder to represent llll nodes (unless the attribute firsteleminllllisllllname is set).

attribute.name: maxdecimals
attribute.digest: Maximum Number of Decimals in Floating-Point Numbers
attribute.description: Maximum number of decimals to represent floating point numbers in lllls.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Maximum Number of Decimals in Floating-Point Numbers

attribute.name: maxdepth
attribute.description: Maximum depth level at which the tree branching must stop. If it is negative, the depth level is counted from the innermost level of each branch of the tree. Defaults to 0, i.e. there is no limitation (equivalent to -1: stop at the innermost level).

attribute.name: maxundosteps
attribute.description: Sets the maximum number of undo steps. 0 means that undo/redo system will be made inactive. The "inf" symbol means unlimited undo steps. Defaults to 50. You should change it to 0 if you perform heavy operations in real-time.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description: If the mode is Node-Link (default), a diagram with nodes linked via lines is displayed vertically. each llll branches into its "leaves" ("sons") via multiple lines. If the mode is Outline or Checkbox Outline a diagram in the "Folder Inspect" style is displayed, where everything is written line by line, and sons are indented, and each llll can be "open" or "closed". In the Checkbox Outline, each element also has a checkbox associated with it (also see getcheck and setcheck messages).

attribute.name: onlyclickonleaves
attribute.description: If this flag is set, the user will have the ability to click only on non-llll elements inside the tree (i.e.: on "leaves"), while the llll levels will ignore the click.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

attribute.name: outputllllnames
attribute.description: If this flag is set and firsteleminllllisllllname is set to 1, when the user clicks on a node representing an llll (displayed with its name), only the name is output and not the whole llll.

attribute.name: presetmode
attribute.description: Sets the elements which are recovered when a preset is called.

attribute.name: preventedit
attribute.description: Prevents the editing of bach.tree's nodes, via mouse and keyboard. By default this is inactive (nodes are editable).

attribute.name: rowvpad
attribute.description: Vertical pad for each row of the Outline mode, in pixels.

attribute.name: separation
attribute.description: Minimum separation in pixels from two elements on the same branch, at the same level of depth, for font size 12 (and scaled accordingly for other font sizes).

attribute.name: showfocus
attribute.description: Show that the object has the focus by increasing the width of the border.

attribute.name: showrootnode
attribute.description: Toggles the display of a first "virtual" node representing the whole llll (i.e. the root level).

attribute.name: textcolor
attribute.description: The color of the text.

attribute.name: textdecayfactor
attribute.description: Factor for the font size which is applied to each depth level, so that one can have the text reducing in size at each level (from top to bottom).

attribute.name: tricolor
attribute.description: The color of the triangle (for the Outline or Checkbox Outline mode)

attribute.name: unwrap
attribute.description: If this flag is set, when an llll node has been clicked, the external level of parenthesis of the corresponding llll is discarded, before outputting it.

attribute.name: verboseundo
attribute.description: Toggles the ability of undo system to post the performed undo or redo steps in the Max window. By default this is inactive.

attribute.name: vinset
attribute.description: Vertical inset of the tree display, in pixels.

c74object.discussion: The incoming llll is displayed in tree form. Clicked elements (and addresses) are output from dedicated outlets. Basic llll editing is possible via mouse and keyboard.

entry.name: Outlet 3 (llll)
entry.description:
The address of the clicked element. An address is an llll providing a unique representation of the position of an element in another llll. It is a concept shared by many bach object. The address of each element of an llll's root level is simply its position counting from 1. The address of an element in a sublist is a list composed by the position of the element in the sublist, preceded by the position of the sublist in the parent llll, and so on up to the root level, as a sort of "path" to the element.
For instance, given the llll a b c (d e (f g) h i) j k the position of c is 3; the position of (d e (f g) h i) is 4; the position if e is 4 2 since to reach it it takes to go to the 4th element of the root level, which is a sublist, and to the 2nd element of that sublist. By reading the address from right to left, it can be seen that this is equivalent to saying that the pointed element is the 2nd of the 4th. Likewise, in the above llll f has the address 4 3 1 since it is the 1st of the 3rd of the 4th.

entry.name: Outlet 5 (bang)
entry.description: bang when changed. This outlet sends a bang whenever the tree llll has been changed via the interface.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: The incoming llll is displayed in tree form. Clicked elements (and addresses) are output from dedicated outlets. Basic llll editing is possible via mouse and keyboard.

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: display, edit, tree, outline, branch, leaf, diagram.
